body.p: Dr F C. Marshall and J. S. Pope state on oath that they ^are^ Physicians residing in the town of Chaplintown Nelson County Ky and practicing in partnership -- that they have as Physicians frequently been called to attend H C. Miller in sickness during the years 1861 and 1862 That said Miller was during that time and still is in very bad health and very frequently is and has been unable to walk or ride about and often confined to his bed, They were visiting him the latter part of Sept 1861 and find from their books that they visited him the 27th Sept 1861, They frequently sent medicine instead of visiting him and frequently at such time made no charge on their books which prevents them stating specifically upon that subject. They were also attending him during a sever illness in the latter part of March 1862 and find from their books that they visited him on the 30th & 31st of March 1862 -- That during the times that they have attended him or have sent him medicine he was not in condition to be able to ride to Bardstown. Affiants do not now remember the exact time the Nelson Circuit court were held.

J L Pope
F. C. Marshall
Sworn to before me the 11th day of July 1862 J L. Pope and F C Marshall
T K Marshall J P. N. C

Nelson Cir Ct
For Recog
Thos Craycroft
Remissi Is July 16 1862
